abstract: More than a quarter of Goldman Sachs’s partners hedged their stock from 2007 to 2010, fueling concerns that executives had broken the ties between compensation and company performance.
snippet: More than a quarter of Goldman Sachs’s partners hedged their stock from 2007 to 2010, fueling concerns that executives had broken the ties between compensation and company performance.
lead_paragraph: Intent on fixing a banking system that contributed heavily to the recent financial crisis, lawmakers and regulators pushed Wall Street to overhaul its pay practices. Big banks responded by shifting more compensation into stock, a move intended to align employees’ interests more closely with those of investors and discourage excessive risk-taking.

headline.main: Stock-Hedging Lets Bankers Skirt Efforts to Overhaul Pay
